instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not posting
threads.message:
Hi,
Came in with little bit corrosion on the upper side. Fan turns on for 1 sec, then turns on again for about 15 sec then turns again and it does't stop but no post. 
L7310/L7320 = 1,7V
L7630=1V
L7430=1,2V.
Have tried another <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> but all the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not posting
threads.message:
"little bit corrosion on the upper side"
Which area?

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high?
Any previous repair attempt done?
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
I suppose you don't use J6100, remove it.
And try known good working clean ME BIOS; links posted on the forum for sure...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - not posting
threads.message:
"Which area?" - See attached image 
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high, 3,3V.
Measured every SPI Bus Series Termination resistor and everything looks fine. 
Tried also clean ME BIOS. 
Can it be bad SMC?
